description.raw:
The buttons in BLACS look pretty silly being borderless when there is no theme applied. So there should either be a default theme or disabling of the borderlessness for buttons within tabs. I prefer the option of setting a default theme, so I've made the green theme be pre-set in the theming plugin if there is not already a stylesheet saved. I also changed the theme to make the buttons smaller.

- Make green theme default. Not by setting it in BLACS proper, merely by making it the theming plugin's default stylesheet if there is not one set. That means people updating who are already using a custom stylesheet will not see the changes unless they delete their stylesheet and replace it and click the "append example" button.

- Shrank 'green theme' font and padding in buttons.

- Darker text on unchecked buttons to improve readability at smaller font size.

Before:

![blacs_buttons_before.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/9pKE7ad/images/344883807-blacs_buttons_before.png)

After:

![blacs_buttons_after.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/9pKE7ad/images/1947915232-blacs_buttons_after.png)
